intro: Thyrsia schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's thyrse, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in the Cape Province. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
